column1: Osteoarthritis with High Risk of Developing Ulcers
column2: PAIN@102, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I RECENTLY STARTED ARTHROTEC 75 FOR OSTEOARTHRITIS, DUE TO HAVING A VERY HARD TIME WALKING. I STARTED TAKING ARTHROTEC AFTER JUST EATING A FEW BITES IN MORNING (NOT A BRKFAST FAN) AND EXPERIENCED SEVERE STOMACH PAIN, BUT AFTER TRYING TO EAT A LITTLE MORE AND THEN TAKING THE TAB I HAVE NOT FELT ANYMORE STOMACH PAIN. I ALSO HAVE EXPERIENCED SOME MUSCLE WEAKNESS, BUT TO BE HONEST I THINK I CAN LIVE WITH THAT MUCH BETTER THEN WITH THE PAIN THAT I HAD ON A DAILY BASES. SPECIALLY WHEN THE WEATHER WAS DAMP OR COLD IT WAS ALMOST IMPOSSIBLE TO WALK. YES I STILL EXPERIENCE SOME PAIN BUT WITH THE MEDICATION MY PAIN LEVEL IS ABOUT 3-4 WHERE WITHOUT IT WOULD BE 8-10 ON A PAIN SCALE. SO BELIEVE ME AS WE ALL KNOW ALL MEDS HAVE SIDE EFFECTS AND I HAVE TRIED MANY. I DO WORK IN A PAIN MANAGEMENT FACILITY AND HAVE TRIED DIFFERENT OPTIONS, BUT SO FAR ARTHROTEC HAS WORKED PRETTY WELL AND BE SURE TO STAY UP ON YOU'R LAB WORK TO MONITOR ANY CHANGES.

column9: Went to every type of physician for my body and joint pain. My RH has been negative for years. I had tried every prescription strength, non-sterriodal oral pain killer on the market. Every morning I would be so stiff all over I would cry in pain. Then this physcian put on Arthrotec, I have been painfree for almost 6 years now. There is generic available brandname is "Cytopan" same generic ingredients. If I miss a dose I know it pretty quickly. So far so good. I had to consult a Rhumatologist for review in Canada he and several others say I don't have arthritis and should get off this medication and methotrexate that I have been taking for the last 6 years. I don't know what to do.

This is my miracle drug.

column1: Rheumatic Disease causing Pain &amp; Stiffness in Backbone
column2: 3x2muchpain, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This was added to my regimen of methotrexate, plaquenil, prednisone, etc.  I first took it in the a.m. and p.m.  But, began waking up at about 2a.m. with terrible stomach pains.  Stopped the p.m. dose and ok.  I take nexium every a.m. about 30 minutes or more before I eat breakfast then take all the other drugs.  Thsi drug is very hard on your stomach, so take it after eating.  The nexium helps me to tolerate it.  I have Osteo arthritis and RA and my GP thought this would help with some of the stiffness.  It does help my hands a little.  But, nothing seems to help with the stenosis in my lower spine.  May ask my RA to DC this drug for me next time I see him since I am going to start neurontin soon.

column2: TINA POTTER, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I suffer from Arthritis in my knees,hips,ankles,neck, basically every joint.  I was taking Tramidol and Celebrex for over a year and in constant pain. I'm not sure what is in this drug, but bottle it. In 2 days my pain was gone. back to sleeping again too.  I still have trouble with going up and down stairs, but no pain
